Job Title: Research Chemist - Oral Care

Location: Princeton, NJ

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
A collective energy and ambition. A place where you can make a real difference.

We're a company that genuinely cares about our people, our products, our consumers and the environment.

Our unique, informal culture champions courage, determination and collaboration. Knowing we have an open and supportive team means each of us has the freedom to take responsibility and ownership. We have a shared passion to work hard, innovate and push boundaries.

United by the belief that when we strive for growth, anything is possible. While we might not be the largest company in our industry, we believe we can have the biggest impact because: Together We Have the Power to Win.

Responsibilities

Role Accountabilities and Responsibilities (Describe the 5-7 major accountabilities)

Help lead product research and development from concept to launch, as well as post launch activities: Collaborate with cross-functional team to develop product. Aid in transfer of technologies to pilot lab and manufacturing sites. Provide technical support for (1) production start-ups and new product launches, (2) existing brand maintenance and improvement, and (3) manufacturing operations to maintain quality and integrity of existing products.Identify product concepts and technical approaches, demonstrate concept and technical feasibility, formulate detailed development plans and execute such plans to meet objectives and commitments.Conduct bench-top formula development of oral care products: Design and execute experiments. Collect and analyze stability data. Report results, draw conclusions and make data-based recommendations to management.Design and execute laboratory experiments to substantiate label claims. Coordinate and support testing by internal service groups and/or external testing labs.Stay abreast on market and competitor activities, as well as consumer product feedback. Help explore ways to increase customer satisfaction levels with new and existing products by identifying and understanding consumer needs and the gaps between consumer needs and existing products.Create, update, and maintain electronic product specifications. Assemble product Bundle Book/ Design History Files, and relevant documentation to support launch of new products and maintain existing ones. Adhere to and follow established procedures and policies for working in the laboratory designated for the development of FDA regulated OTC products.

Education and Experience 

The successful candidate will have a B.S. degree from an accredited institution in Chemistry/Chemical Engineering, Biochemistry or related disciplines, with 5+ years of laboratory experience. A Ph.D in a relevant discipline with 0 - 3 years experience is acceptable. Familiarity with FDA regulated OTC products preferred.

Skills And Competencies

Ability to work independently on assigned tasks with minimal supervision.Ability to develop, organize and prioritize tasks within assigned projects and work with supervisor to manage assigned projects.Ability to work on multiple, concurrent projects.Demonstrated strong organizational, work planning, and problem-solving skills.Ability to manage large workload at times and to adapt to reprioritization as necessary in a rapidly changing environment.Ability to work in a cross-functional environment involving marketing, processing, packaging, analytical, safety, clinical, regulatory, etc.Good oral and written skills.
